intro: Manglilla melanophloeos, commonly known as the black bark manglilla, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems with a dark, almost black bark. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Manglilla melanophloeos is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded habitats.
